question: a goal; Specify pronunciation.
answer: un but ('boot') OR un objectif; The T in 'but' is pronounced - likely because the origin of the word is foreign.

question: a challenge
answer: un défi; challenge (pronounced with the anglo/czech CH) is often used by the French instead of the more idiomatic défi.

question: to challenge someone to do something
answer: défier quelqu'un DE faire quelque chose; se défier = to challenge oneself (e.g. to take a difficult course)

question: idiomatic way to say: I will work very hard.
answer: Je ferai de mon mieux.; Literally it translates to: I will do my best.; There is not a good direct translation for working hard.

question: an effort / You make the effort to speak french.
answer: un effort / Tu fais l'effort de parler français.

question: It works! + It might work. + It does not work.
answer: Ça marche! + Ça ne marche pas.; Using marcher (literally 'to walk') is the idiomatic way to express that something is working.

question: It might not work. + It cannot not work.
answer: This is really interesting because the difference in these two meanings occurs only by re-ording the words: Ça peut ne pas marcher. (I might not work. - 50/50 chance) + Ça ne peut pas marcher. (It cannot work. - 100% negative; This is the standard way to negate where NE comes directly after the subject.)

question: Perhaps her efforts will not work.
answer: Peut-être que ses efforts ne marcheront pas.; NB: Use que because it's like 'it's possible that...'. Use futur simple form of marcher.

question: to achieve
answer: achever; Réaliser is more franglais and it is less flexible in French. In French RÉALISER can only mean to manifest something. It cannot be used to mean a discovery or the noticing of something. e.g. réaliser un rêve = to realize a dream

question: to realize (that something exists) / to become aware of something
answer: Depends on context: 1) prendre conscience DE qqch: Use this for significant (philosophical) revelations - not just noticing that something exists. 2) se rendre compte DE qqch: Use this for noticing / realizing something this not an epiphany - not profound.; 3) prendre compte qqch: The meaning of this is closest to 'to take into account'.

question: to know that something exists (not a discovery or new awareness)
answer: Two options: 1) AVOIR conscience DE qqch 2) ÊTRE au courant DE qqch

question: I realized X (a profound realization). + I realized X (noting a mundane fact).
answer: J'ai pris conscience de X. + Je me suis rendu(e) compte de X.; Use prendre conscience de qqch for a major discovery / realization. Use rendre compte de qqch for noticing that something exists (not profound).

question: I took the cat into account when I made the list.
answer: J'ai pris compte le chat quand j'ai fais le liste.; Use prendre compte qqch to mean 'to take into account'. This is different from noticing that something exists: rendre compte de qqch.

question: I am aware of X.
answer: J'ai conscience DE X.; Alternative: Je suis au courant DE X.; Use avoir conscience de qqch and rendre compte de qqch to mean that you are aware of something.

question: What is the difference between SE RENDRE adjective + SE RENDRE À quelque part?
answer: SE RENDRE adjective: to make something that way (e.g. Il rend la femme folle. = He makes the woman crazy.); SE RENDRE À quelque part: to go somewhere (e.g. Elle se rend à Warsaw. = She goes to Warsaw.)

question: SE RENDRE COMPTE de qqch + RENDRE COMPTE de qqch?
answer: SE RENDRE COMPTE de qqch: to notice or realize something (that is not a major revelation); RENDRE COMPTE de qqch (not reflexive): to relay information about something

question: I relayed to you the notes of the meeting. + I realized that the store was closed.
answer: J'ai rendu compte (not reflexive) de la réunion avec les notes. + Je me suis rendu compte (reflexive) que le magasin était fermé.; RENDRE COMPTE de qqch (not reflexive): to relay information about something. SE RENDRE COMPTE de qqch: to notice or realize something (that is not a major revelation).

question: idiomatic way to say: They are having great difficulties.
answer: Ils mangent son pain noir.; This is a reference to the bread (pain noir) that the poor ate prior to the french revolution when only the wealthy could afford white bread. Since the revolution baguettes are regulated to avoid this disparity.

question: idiomatic way to say: It was hard to do that.
answer: J'ai galéré à le faire.; galérer (to struggle) is the verb

question: idiomatic way to say: It was a pain in the ass.
answer: C'était un casse-tête. OR C'était une galére.; galérer (to struggle) is the verb

question: to struggle to do something + to struggle with something
answer: avoir du mal à faire quelque chose + avoir du mal avec quelque chose; Alternatives: avoir des difficultés à faire quelque chose + avoir des difficultés avec quelque chose; NB: This is very different from 'to struggle for a cause / against an enemy'. In that case use: luttre pour/contre X.

question: to fight/struggle against (some force X) + to fight/struggle for (some goal)
answer: lutter contre X + lutter pour X; If instead you mean to struggle to do something in your life: avoir du mal à faire quelque chose.

question: I have trouble reading.
answer: J'ai du mal À lire.; to struggle to do something = avoir du mal à faire quelque chose; to struggle with something = avoir du mal avec quelque chose

question: I struggle with the text.
answer: J'ai du mal AVEC le texte.; to struggle to do something = avoir du mal à faire quelque chose; to struggle with something = avoir du mal avec quelque chose

question: I don't see myself (doing something).
answer: J'ai du mal À me projeter en train de faire (doing) quelque chose.; to struggle to do something = avoir du mal à faire quelque chose; se projeter = to project. It can mean literally to project (like in a movie theater) or to forecast something.

question: I have a tendency to read slowly.
answer: J'ai tendance à lire lentement.; AVOIR TENDANCE À + infinitive.

question: It's hard to motivate myself to write.
answer: C'est difficile de me motiver À écrire.

question: fair competition + unfair competition (economic terms)
answer: la concurrence loyale + la concurrence déloyale

question: a contest/competition
answer: un concours OR une épreuve.; Une épreuve is a competitive event within which there may be multiple matches or heats etc. Do not use un évènement for sporting events.

question: the competition (e.g. among players or companies or countries)
answer: la concurrence

question: a list of the winner's of some competition
answer: un palmarès; It is a reference to a podium.

question: We watch football (soccer). / We watch a game of football.
answer: On regarde DU foot. / On regarde un match de foot.; plural of match = matchs

question: I wanted to go to more (football) matches.
answer: Je voulais aller à plus de matchs.; Use imparfait of VOULOIR (instead of passé composé) because it is a state of being and whatever you wanted in the past is different from what you want at this moment. Also it is much more polite to express this with indicatif imparfait - just as we would use conditionnel présent (voudrais) to express what we want in the present.

question: a game
answer: un jeu; pronounced just like the word for I (je)

question: a board game
answer: un jeu de société; e.g. monopoly

question: a video game
answer: un jeu video; NB: This is called e-sport when done competitively.

question: a game of chance
answer: un jeu de hasard

question: a play on words
answer: un jeu de mots

question: to play with words / to play with fire
answer: You can make a literal translation in these cases. JOUER + AVEC.; jouer avec les mots / jouer avec le feu

question: the olympic games
answer: les jeux‿olympiques ('lay-zhoo-Zo-lim-peek'); There is a Z liaison between jeux and olympiques.; Often people abbreviate: J.O. ('zshee-oh' - like 'geo').

question: a game piece (like a figure in chess)
answer: un pion; This can also refer to a guard or boarding school master: le pion / la pionne

question: a dice (for playing a game)
answer: un dé

question: a game board + a place on a gameboard (where a player can move)
answer: un plateau + une case

question: a playing card
answer: une carte

question: the score (in a game)
answer: le score = the number of points (les points) won by a team or player

question: to draw a card (in a card game) + to deal a card
answer: piocher une carte + distribuer une carte

question: to choose teams (in a game)
answer: tirer au sort les equipes

question: to solve a riddle
answer: résoudre une énigme

question: to finish first (in a game) + to last longer than the other players
answer: arriver le premier + durer plus longtemps que les autres joueurs

question: to eliminate the other players (in a game)
answer: éliminer les adversaires

question: a team + the women's/men's team
answer: un équipe + l'equipe féminin/masculin

question: the opposing team
answer: l'équipe adverse

question: a stadium + a temporary stadium (e.g. for the olympics)
answer: un stade + un stade èphémère

question: a field (where a sport is played)
answer: un terrain is the most generic way to refer to this; Alternative: une pelouse (= a lawn) is used for football

question: a shot / a scoring attempt (e.g. in football)
answer: une frappe

question: a shot of adrenaline
answer: un coup / un shot d'adrénaline; 'shot' is franglais but it works well in this case

question: a tied game/match
answer: un match nul

question: an own goal (e.g. in football)
answer: un but contre son camp

question: a yellow card + a red card (e.g. in football)
answer: un carton jaune + un carton rouge

question: a foul + a handball (e.g. in football)
answer: une faute + une faute de main

question: a penalty kick
answer: un pénalty

question: to be offside (e.g. in football)
answer: être hors jeu

question: to score a goal (e.g. football)
answer: marquer (un but)

question: to make a header (e.g. in football)
answer: faire une tête; un coup ('koo') de tête = a header

question: to make a basket (in basketball)
answer: dunker (for a dunk); dans le basket = in the hoop; POSTER quelqu'un / POSTÉRISER quelqu'un = to dunk on a defender

question: idiomatic way to express: a good sport
answer: un bon perdant; literally: a good loser

question: a ball
answer: It depends on what kind of ball: 1) une balle: ball for tennis + golf + cricket  2) un ballon: for football + rugby + basketball 3) une boule: something physically shaped like a ball

question: a bubble
answer: une bulle

question: a stuffed animal
answer: une peluche; You can use 'en peluche' like a material: un ours EN peluche = a stuffed-animal bear

question: a toy + a doll
answer: un jouet + une poupée

question: a jump rope (that children play with)
answer: une corde à sauter; NB: la marelle = hopscotch

question: hide and seek
answer: cache-cache

question: a puzzle
answer: un puzzle; It has the same meanings in French as in English.

question: a lego + legos
answer: un Lego + les Lego; no S even on the plural version

question: a marble + marbles
answer: une bille ('bee') + les billes

question: What are the three major ways to express doing some activity?
answer: 1) FAIRE + DU / DE LA / DES / D' + some activity  2) JOUER + AU / À LA / AUX  + game/sport 3) JOUER + DU / DE LA / DES / D' + music/musical instrument; à + le = au; à + les = aux; de + le = du; de + les = des; d' is used when the following word starts with a vowel

question: to play sports
answer: faire du sport

question: to play football (soccer)
answer: jouer au foot OR faire du foot; With football you can use either JOUER or FAIRE.

question: to play volleyball
answer: jouer au volley

question: I play tennis.
answer: Je joue ('zshoo') au tennis.; JOUER + À because tennis is a sport/game.; Tennis is masculine singular. à + le = AU.; The present tense conjugations of jouer (e.g. je joue) have only one syllable - despite the multiple vowels - and they sound exactly the same as the word for cheek (une joue); NB: Technically you can use DE with tennis as well: Je fais DU tennis.

question: You play pétanque.
answer: Tu joues ('zshoo') à la pétanque.; JOUER + À because pétanque is a sport/game.; Pétangue is feminine singular so à la remains À LA.

question: We play chess.
answer: Nous jouons ('zshoo-ohn'; pronounced almost as a single syllable) aux échecs.; JOUER + À because chess is a sport/game.; Échecs is plural. à + les = AUX.

question: They play cards. + They play poker.
answer: Ils jouent ('zshoo') aux cartes. + Ils jouent au Poker ('poe-kehR'; The R is pronounced in this case because it is not a french word.); JOUER + À because cards is a sport/game.; Cartes is plural. à + les = AUX.

question: He plays piano.
answer: Il joue ('zshoo') du piano.; JOUER + DE because we are talking about music/musical instrument.; Piano is masculine singular. de + le = du

question: She took piano lessons (e.g. as a kid).
answer: Elle prenait des leçons de piano.; Use imparfait because this is part of a routine in the past.; Alternative: Elle avait des leçons de piano.

question: His friend plays the flute.
answer: Son ami joue ('zshoo') de la flûte.; JOUER + DE because we are talking about music/musical instrument.; Flûte is feminine singular.

question: She plays the drums / the guitar.
answer: Elle joue ('zshoo') de la batterie / de la guitare.; JOUER + DE because we are talking about music/musical instrument.; Drums and guitar are both feminine singular in french.

question: I do not know how to play the violin.
answer: Je ne se pas faire du violin.; Use SAVOIR (not connaître) to talk about knowing how to play an instrument.

question: how I speak
answer: dans ma manière de parler; This cannot be translated directly.; I will incorporate it into how I speak. = Je vais l'incorporer dans ma maniére de parler.; une manière passive de communiquer = a passive way of communicating

question: They play hip-hop music.
answer: Ils font de la musique hip-hop.; We do not use the verb JOUER in this case. Use FAIRE + DE instead.; La musique is feminine singular.

question: My friends played music (with instruments); Specify the pronunciation.
answer: Mes‿amis ont ('meh-Zah-mee-ont') fait de la musique.; No liaison between amis and ont because the subject is not a pronoun. If the subject was a pronoun then make the liaison.; We do not use the verb JOUER in this case. Use faire de la musique instead.

question: We played some games.
answer: On a joué à quelques jeux.; Use quelqueS because games is plural.

question: He played soccer.
answer: Il jouait au football.; Use imparfait to describe someone's hobby in the past.

question: He plays with a doll.
answer: Il joue à la poupée.; Playing with a toy is expressed like playing a game: JOUER + À + article + noun.

question: I dance. + I ski.
answer: Je fais DE LA danse. + Je fais DU ski.; Use FAIRE + DE.; La dance is feminine singular. Le ski is masculine singular. de + le = du.

question: He rides a bike.
answer: Il fait du vélo.; Use FAIRE + DE. Le vélo is masculine singular. de + le = du.

question: She rides horses.
answer: Elle fait de l'équitation.; Use FAIRE + DE. l'équitation makes the contraction because it starts with a vowel.

question: to do gymnastics + to do yoga
answer: faire de la gymnastique + faire du yoga; Use FAIRE + DE. DE + LE = DU.

question: to go hiking + to go climbing
answer: faire de la randonnée (feminine) + faire de l'escalade (feminine)

question: I go to the gym.
answer: Je vais à la salle de sport.; NB: un gymnase = a place where athletes perform gymnastics

question: to exercise + to do cardio
answer: faire de l'exercice + faire du cardio; Alternatives: pour endurance (for endurance) / pour rester en forme (to stay in shape)

question: a push-up + a sit-up (the exercises)
answer: une pompe + un sit-up

question: Idiomatic way to say: He did cheerleading after school.
answer: Il faisait l'entraînement de cheerleading après être allé à l'école.; Use imparfait because it is describing a daily routine in the past.

question: to listen to music
answer: ècouter DE la musique; Always use a preposition and an article (DE LA) after écouter.

question: a guitar + a drum + a bass
answer: une guitare + un tambour + une basse

question: a harp + a trumpet + a violin
answer: une harpe + une trompette + un violon

question: We stay here.
answer: On reste ici.

question: a household
answer: un ménage; This can mean a couple or any group of people that live together.

question: to browse / to go bargain hunting
answer: chiner; a bargain-hunter = chineur/euse

question: to go shopping (for luxury clothing or goods)
answer: faire du shopping; This specifically means shopping for luxury goods.; faire les courses = running errands (e.g. groceries)

question: to go shopping (for daily food + home goods/furniture + clothing + gifts)
answer: faire les courses; This means running errands.; faire du shopping = shopping for luxury goods.

question: to run an errand
answer: faire une course; This is the singular of running errands = faire les courses.; faire du shopping = shopping for luxury goods

question: Use for housework. + Do not use for housework.
answer: Utilisez pour faire le ménage (always singular). + N'utilisez pas pour faire le ménage.

question: the task
answer: la tâche

question: the chores + to share the chores
answer: les tâches ménagéres + partager des tâches

question: to share (e.g. a plate)
answer: partager

question: The responsbility must be shared.
answer: La responsibilité doit être partagée (feminine because subject is singular feminine).

question: to split a bill 50/50
answer: faire moitié moitié OR faire moit moit (both Ts are pronounced; more casual) OR faire 50/50

question: to do housework + to tidy up
answer: faire le ménage + ranger; Use RANGER to mean put things back in their place. Use ARRANGER to mean re-arrange furniture / setup a room.; e.g. ranger des affaires = to get the affairs in order

question: to put together the furniture + to arrange the furniture
answer: monter/constuire les meubles + AMÉNAGER (or ARRANGER) les meubles/la maison; SURMONTER can mean 'to mount' or 'to overcome'.; AMÉNAGER can also mean to 'fit out' a space + landscape a terrain + to 'put in' an installation + to develop a neighborhood. Watch out because EMMÉNAGER (E with 2 Ms) means to 'move in' to new housing.

question: to disassemble the furniture
answer: démonter les meubles (not démontrer which means to demonstrate); Monter with auxiliare être = to go up / to take oneself up. Monter with auxiliare avoir = to take upstairs (or assemble) some object (COD).

question: It fits well in the space
answer: Ça va bien aller dans la pièce.

question: to build
answer: construire or bâtir; CONSTRUIRE is used exclusively for constructing something from scratch. If you are starting from components (e.g. putting together IKEA furniture or mounting electronics with wiring in the walls) then you must use MONTER with auxiliare avoir (instead of construire).; The conjugation of CONSTRUIRE is like conduire (the R changes to S): je construis (présent) + je construisais (imparfait)

question: idiomatic way to express: to build from scratch
answer: bâtir à partir de rien

question: to frame
answer: encadrer; This is used the same way in french as it is in english. e.g. to frame a picture + to frame a face (after a haircut)

question: to open + to cover
answer: ouvrir + couvrir; COUVRIR is typically conjugated similar to OUVRIR.; NB: ROUVRIR (to open again) and RECOUVRIR (to cover again) are often used to simply mean 'to open' or 'to cover'. It is common in french to add R- or RE- prefix to a verb to emphasize it or adjust the meaning. This does not necessarily mean that the verb is performed again.

question: to discover + to reveal
answer: découvrir + révéler; Conjugation is similar to OUVRIR (e.g. past participle: découvert).;

question: the discovery
answer: la découverte

question: to burry + to escavate/uncover
answer: enterrer + deterrer

question: to wrap + to unwrap
answer: emballer + déballer; This only works for packaging or a gift. It does not work for packing/unpacking luggage.

question: arranged well (like for a room) + disorganized
answer: bien rangé(e) / bien organisé(e) + dérangé(e) / désorganisé(e); NB: SE DÉRANGER = to be bothered by something

question: My things are totally arranged in their place
answer: Mes affaires sont toutes bien rangées à leurs places.

question: messy
answer: désordonné(e) OR en désordre; the disorder = le désordre

question: organized (like for a person)
answer: organisé(e)

question: to have a sense of organization (in general) + to have a sense of the organization (the heirarchy of a specific company)
answer: avoir un sens ('sohnS'; S is pronounced) d'organisation + avoir le sens de l'organisation

question: well-situated / in a good location
answer: bien situé(e)

question: well-decorated + well-equipped
answer: bien décoré(e) + bien equipé(e); un décor = the decoration of a room

question: to clean + the cleaning
answer: nettoyer + le nettoyage; NB: You cannot use 'le nettoyage' on its own. You must specify WHAT is being cleaned during the cleaning. e.g. Il y avait beaucoup de nettoyage À faire chez nous. = There was a lot of cleaning (happening) at our place.

question: to sweep
answer: ramoner; This is the word to use for cleaning a chimney.

question: to dry
answer: se sécher

question: dry + wet
answer: sec/sèche (m/f) + mouillé(e)

question: the laundry (the clothes to wash)
answer: le linge

question: to do the laundry (to wash clothes)
answer: laver le linge OR faire la lessive OR faire une machine (familiar); NB: s'occuper du linge = washing AND drying AND ironing clothes

question: to iron the clothes
answer: repassage; NB: s'occuper du linge = washing AND drying AND ironing clothes

question: to wash the dishes by hand + to wash the dishes in a dishwasher + to wash the dishes in a restaurant
answer: faire la viselle (means by hand) +  mettre dans le lave-vaisselle + faire la plonge (means professionally in a restaurant)

question: to eat without having to do dishes
answer: manger sans la vaisselle

question: a housewife
answer: une ménagère; This is the feminine version of the adjective ménager/ménagère which means of the household.

question: to sew + sewing / tailoring
answer: coudre + la couture; faire un ourlet = to make a hem (e.g. in pants or a skirt)

question: to mend
answer: recoudre

question: to tailor (clothing)
answer: faire sur measure; TAILLER is a faux amis that means to cut / to prune but it can be used to describe something that a tailor does.

question: I measure with a ruler.
answer: Je mesure avec une règle.; MESURER triggers the preposition AVEC.

question: to tinker (in order to repair something)
answer: bricoler

question: to do it yourself
answer: faire les choses soi-même

question: on itself
answer: en lui-même

question: a makeshift job / a do-it-yourself project
answer: le bricolage; e.g. Elle aime le bricolage = She likes doing DIY (activities).

question: the instructions + the requirements
answer: les instructions + les exigences; NB: le mode d'emploi = the instruction manual for a piece of equipment

question: the playbook
answer: un 'guide pratique'; As far as I know there is no idiomatic translation for playbook. So parenthesis are required.

question: to repair
answer: réparer; Fix is faux ami. fixer = to choose or to set (something)

question: to repaint (a room)
answer: repeindre

question: to develop (like a product or an argument or an economy)
answer: développer

question: to prefer
answer: préférer; 2 accent aigu!

question: How does préférer change as it is conjugated au présent?
answer: je préfère + tu préfères + il préfère + nous préférons + vous préférez + ils préfèrent; préférer is an -ER verb so the minor variations (changing accent aigu to accent grave) do not impact the nous and vous forms.

question: to return something (e.g. clothes to a store)
answer: retourner OR faire un retour; retourner is only used when you are returning some thing (a direct object) to a place that is different from where the speaker is currently located.; RETOURNER uses être in passé composé.; Do not use this when you are talking about the movement of a person. See REVENIR and RENTRER.

question: to ask for your money back (when disatisfied with something)
answer: faire un réclamation; This is different from making a return of something you bought: retourner or faire un retour

question: to return / to go back / to come back (when a person - not a thing - is returning)
answer: There are three verbs to choose from. 1) Revenir is like 'come back' to a location that is the same as where the speaker is currently located. Revenir en arrière = to go back in time or place; 2) Rentrer means 'to go back home' wherever home is. It can refer to the actual home/apartment or a city/region.; 3) Retourner can be used similar to English. e.g. On y retournera pour Noël. = We will return there for Christmas.

question: I'm back.
answer: Je suis de retour.; Literally: I am returned.

question: If you could go back (in time)...
answer: Si tu pouvais revenir en arrière...

question: idiomatic way to say: It can't be undone. / We can't turn back time.
answer: On ne peux pas revenir/retourner en arrière.; If we wanted to translate literally the English translation...You can't put the toothpaste back in the tube. = Tu ne peux pas remettre le dentifrice à l'intérieur du tube.

question: the feedback (like on a job)
answer: le retour; This can also mean the return of something you bought and the return trip of a voyage.

question: to dine
answer: dîner

question: We picnic.
answer: On pique-nique. OR On fait un pique-nique.; le pique-nique = the picnic; pique-niquer = to picnic

question: to travel
answer: voyager

question: a thought
answer: une pensée

question: an estimate or quote (for repairs)
answer: un devis; Do not use estimation. That is a faux amis.

question: to think
answer: penser (Je pense. = I think.) It is a regular -ER verb.; NB: When you use PENSER in the past you almost always use imparfait (instead of passé composé) because if you thought something in the past then it is likely that you think something different now.

question: I am thinking about leaving tomorrow.
answer: Je pense partir demain.; No preposition is required after PENSER to join with another a verb.

question: to think about (something) + to have an option on (something)
answer: penser à + penser de; A preposition is required after PENSER to join with a noun. The choice of preposition changes the meaning of the verb.

question: to think deeply about (something)
answer: réfléchir profondément À (quelque chose); Generally RÉFLÉCHIR means to think over / to ponder / to mull when NOT used reflexively - which is the major use case. When used reflexively (SE RÉFLÉCHIR) it means to reflect.; RÉFLÉCHIR is different from PENSER (to think but more in a yes/no sense; e.g. Do you think that...?)

question: After reflecting / thinking...
answer: Après réflexion...; Do not use réfléchir in this case.

question: a reflection
answer: Depends on meaning: 1) un reflet: speaks to the result. e.g. the reflection you see in a mirror or the glinting of light reflecting off of a surface  2) une réflexion: speaks to the action. e.g. the bending of light or the turning of a thought in your head

question: to consider (something)
answer: envisager OR estimer; ESTIMER is a faux ami. It means to think about something in a loose way / to consider something.

question: It is a thing to consider.
answer: C'est une chose à prendre en compte.; à prendre compte (DE qqch) = to take (something) into account; rendre compte (qqch) = to become aware (of something); Do not use ENVISAGER or ESTIMER in this case.

question: There are too many cultures to count.
answer: Il y a beaucoup trop cultures à compter.; Use À (instead of DE) to link to a verb.

question: There are too many to list.
answer: Il y a beaucoup trop à lister.; Use À to link to a verb.

question: to count + an account
answer: compter + un compte; COMPTER can also mean to intend to do something.; je compte + tu comptes + ...

question: an accounting
answer: une comptabilité

question: They count the money.
answer: Ils comptent l'argent.

question: to concentrate + to concentrate on X
answer: concentrer + se concentrer sur X

question: idiomatic way to express: I drop everything and focus on studying.
answer: Je fais en sorte d'étudier.; FAIRE EN SORTE DE + INFINITIVE = to make sure (drop everything else) in order to some activity

question: to imagine + to re-imagine
answer: to imagine: IMAGINER; to re-imagine: REPENSER means to re-imagine or re-think something. REVISITER means to re-imagine or to re-work something (not to physically visit something again)

question: to wonder + to wander
answer: s'interroger + errer; s'interroger can mean 'to ponder' but RÉFLÉCHIR is probably a better verb for that.

question: to become; Specify pronunciation.
answer: deVENIR ('duh-vuh-NEER'; pronounce differently from DEVINER); The base is venir (to come). The conjugation in present tense is exactly the same.

question: to guess; Specify pronunciation.
answer: supposer OR deVINER ('duh-VEE-NAY'; pronounce differently from DEVENIR); DEVINER is correct but old-fashioned. SUPPOSER is a better verb.; Alternative: IMAGINER (same meaning as english)

question: a guess + a suggestion
answer: une supposition + une suggestion (Two G sounds: 'soog-zshuh-syohn'); SUPPOSER = to guess; SUGGÉRER = to suggest

question: I guessed it.
answer: Je l'ai supposé.; Alternative: Je l'ai deviné. DEVINER is correct but very old-fashioned. SUPPOSER is the better verb but it is almost a faux ami. Use PRESUMER to mean 'to assume'.

question: to propose something to someone
answer: proposer (à qqn de faire qqch) OR suggérer (à qqn de faire qqch); The connotations (proposer = to propose; suggérer = to suggest) are the same from French to English. PROPOSER = to propose something as an option. SUGGÉRER = to suggest to someone that they should do something (more pressure).

question: to suggest; Specify pronunciation.
answer: suggérer; It's really important to make both of the back-to-back G-sounds: 'sooG-zshuh-ray'. The first sound is a hard English G. The second sound is a soft English G. The pronunciation of both Gs is so prominent that the first syllable is almost like a separate word.

question: She suggests that Daniel take the test.
answer: Elle propose/suggère À Daniel DE PASSER l'examen.; In English we make proposals with two phrases: She proposes/suggests... that Daniel... In French we use the smaller prepositional phrases: propose/suggérer À qqn (often a pronoun placed before the verb) DE faire qqch (infinitive).; The different connotation of proposer (to propose) vs suggérer (to suggest) are the same in English and French.

question: I suggest that you do something about it.
answer: Je te/vous suggère DE FAIRE quelque chose à ce sujet.; In English we make proposals with two phrases: I propose/suggest... that you... In French we use the smaller prepositional phrases: proposer/suggérer À qqn (often a pronoun placed before the verb) DE faire qqch (infinitive).; The different connotations of proposer vs suggérer are the same in English and French.

question: We propose that he order the fish.
answer: Nous lui proposons DE commander le poisson.; In English we make proposals with two phrases: We propose/suggest... that he... In French we use the smaller prepositional phrases: proposer/suggérer À qqn (often a pronoun placed before the verb) DE faire qqch (infinitive).; The different connotations of proposer vs suggérer are the same in English and French.

question: She proposes / suggests teaching French.
answer: Elle propose/suggère D'enseigner le français.; The structure for making proposals: propose/suggérer À qqn (often a pronoun placed before the verb) DE faire qqch (infinitive).; The different connotation of proposer (to propose) vs suggérer (to suggest) are the same in English and French.

question: I suggest that you turn off the light and change the bulb.
answer: Je te/vous suggère D'éteindre la lumière et DE changer l'ampoule.; When using a series of items in a prepositional phrase (e.g. pour + de + avec) you must repeat the preposition for each item.

question: I would rather do something else.
answer: Je serais plutôt pour faire autre chose.

question: to assume (something)
answer: présumer; SUPPOSER (to guess) and ASSUMER (to assume responsibility for) are faux amis.

question: to take responsibility for something
answer: assumer; ASSUMER only means to take responsibility for something. It does not mean to assume meaning.; Use PRÉSUMER to mean 'to assume the meaning of something'. Use SUPPOSER to mean 'to guess'.

question: to believe; Conjugate it.
answer: croire; je crois ('kwa') + tu crois + il croit + nous croyons + vous croyez + ils croient; past participle: cru; NB: CROIRE can use many different prepositions to adjust the meaning.

question: I believe the person. + I believe in myself.
answer: Je crois À la personne. + Je me crois.; CROIRE uses many different prepositions to adjust the meaning.

question: I believe in the person. + I believe completely in the person.
answer: Je crois EN la personne. + Je crois DANS la personne.; CROIRE uses many different prepositions to adjust the meaning.

question: I believe you.
answer: Je te crois. ('kwa')

question: to make (something) up
answer: inventer

question: to behave
answer: se comporter; le compartment = the behavior

question: to act (on something) + to act (in a play)
answer: agir + jouer/performer (literally: to play / to perform); NB: The verb ACTER exists but it not commonly used to describe actors.

question: to interact with (something)
answer: interagir avec (quelque chose); NB: an interaction = une interaction

question: to belong
answer: appartenir; This is conjugated similar to VENIR. e.g. j'appartiens + tu appartiens + ...

question: a feeling of belonging
answer: une appartenance; e.g. l'appartenance ethnique = the ethnicity; comes from the verb APPARTENIR = to belong

question: to pass by
answer: PASSER. Use être in passé composé because the verb is being used to indicate physical position.; PASSER can be used to indicate passing by something or spending time doing something. But it should not be used to talk about spending money.

question: to spend time
answer: PASSER using avoir in passé composé because the verb is not being used to indicate physical position in this case.; PASSER can be used to indicate passing by something or spending time doing something. But it should not be used to talk about spending money.

question: to spend money
answer: dépenser / débourser; Do not use PASSER for this purpose.

question: to buy + to pay
answer: acheter + payer ('pay-yay'; two Y sounds); When you pay any kind of bill (restaurant + doctors office + utility) use PAYER. It describes the one side of the transaction. ACHETER is only used to describe an exchange for a physical thing (e.g. buying clothes) and so it also triggers use of pronom EN.

question: How does acheter change as it is conjugated au présent?
answer: j'achète + tu achètes + il achète + nous achetons + vous achetez + ils achètent; acheter is an -ER verb so the minor variations (adding accent grave è) do not impact the nous and vous forms.

question: to hold
answer: tenir

question: to exagerate
answer: exagérer

question: to summarize
answer: résumer

question: to write a summary/paragraph
answer: faire une rédaction

question: to draft (a piece of writing)
answer: faire un brouillon

question: I take notes.
answer: Je prends ('shhhhhpruh' one syllable) des notes.; JE is pronounced slowly as a long 'shhhh' sound. But you must avoid making it a separate syllable. It's not 'shuh-pruh'. It's 'shhhhhpruh'.

question: I prepared a lot for the exam.
answer: Je me suis beaucoup préparé au examen.; If you use PRÉPARER without a reflexive pronoun then it means to prepare a meal. You must use SE PRÉPARER À qqch (or s'apprêter à) to indicate that you are preparing yourself for some task. Using the reflexive form of the verb forces us to use ÊTRE as the auxiliary - instead of AVOIR.

question: How should I prepare for it?
answer: Comment est-ce que je dois ME préparer?; If you use PRÉPARER without a reflexive pronoun then it means to prepare a meal. You must use SE PRÉPARER À qqch (or s'apprêter à) to indicate that you are preparing yourself for some task.; In this case we are not using inversion so we add est-ce que to make the form correct. You could omit est-ce que but then it would be very familiar...using intonation.; NB: Using inversion instead is correct but - in this case - it is a little bizarre because it sounds so formal: Comment dois-je le préparer?

question: She gets ready to leave.
answer: Elle s'apprête à partir.; SE APPRÊTER is an alternative to SE PRÉPARER. It is also the verb formed from the adjective prêt(e) which means ready and willing.

question: to immerse (oneself) in something
answer: s'immerger

question: You immerse yourself (informal) in French.
answer: Tu t'immerge DANS français.; The masculine version of a nationality is the short form for the language.

question: to help (to do something)
answer: aider À = to help / to facilitate; AIDER + À + verb: Il m'aide à parler français. = He helps me to speak French.; AIDER + noun: Cela aide le travail. = It facilitates the work.

question: We took the large apartment to facilitate our transition to France.
answer: Nous avons pris le grand appartement pour AIDER notre transition vers la France.; AIDER = to help / to facilitate.

question: a lesson
answer: une leçon / un cours (more like 'a class')

question: I have french lessons every Sunday online.
answer: J'ai des cours de français tous les dimanches en ligne.; dimanche = on Sunday. le dimanche = on every Sunday. à dimanche = see you on Sunday.

question: a test
answer: un examen OR un contrôle; e.g. J'ai un contrôle de maths. = I have a math test.

question: a mock exam
answer: un examen blanc

question: a multiple-choice (scan-tron) test
answer: QCM

question: an education + educational
answer: une éducation + éducatif / éducative (m/f); la scholarité = base education before 15/16 years old

question: a school
answer: une école; Alternatives: une académie + un conservatoire + un institut

question: an institution + an establishement
answer: une institution + un établissement; These are good alternatives to almost anything when trying to avoid repitition. e.g. un établissement scolaire = an educational establishment/institution

question: a nursery (where you take babies and toddlers) + a nursery school (ages 3 to 5)
answer: une crèche + une école maternelle

question: an elementary school (ages 6-10) + a middle school (ages 11-14)
answer: une école élémentaire + un collège

question: a high school (ages 15-18) + a university (ages 18+)
answer: un lycée ('lee-say') + une université (or une faculté); une conseillère d'orientation = school counselor who helps students prepare and get into university; à la fac = at university

question: an ivy league university (in France)
answer: une grande école; Grand(e) means 'significant' when placed before the noun. It means 'grown/tall' when placed after the noun.

question: in primary school + in high school
answer: en primaire (spelled differently than the adjective for first) + en lycée; Do not use DANS for any of these.

question: a degree (in education) + I received the degree.
answer: un diplôme + J'ai obtenu un diplôme.; Use OBTENIR (never recevoir) for getting/receiving a degree.; Alternatively you can say: J'ai eu un diplôme. (using AVOIR)

question: a graduation (the ceremony) + to graduate
answer: une remise de diplômes + faire un diplôme; une remise can also mean a reduction in price

question: the name of the exam that everyone in France takes to gain entrance to university
answer: le bac;Le bac is not required. But it must be taken in order to apply for university.; Le bac is the reference point for continued study. e.g. BAC + 3 = un licence (a bachelor's degree)

question: a bachelor's degree in biochemistry
answer: une licence en biochemie (no dash); NB: a bachelor's degree in biochemical engineering = une licence en génie de biochemie; NB: In France a bachelor's degree (un licence) typically consumes 3 years and is referred to as BAC + 3.

question: a master's degree in business
answer: un master en affaires; NB: In France a master's degree typically consumes 2 years (after completion of undergraduate study) and is referred to as BAC + 5.; Je suis titulaire d'un Master en affaires. = I have an MBA.

question: a doctorate degree in marketing
answer: un doctorat en marketing; NB: In France a doctorate typically consumes 3 years (after completion of masters) and is referred to as BAC + 8.

question: idiomatic way to say: He attended X university.
answer: Il est allé(e) à l'université du X.; e.g. Il est allé à l'université du Harvard.

question: formal job training that does not include a diploma
answer: une formation

question: It opens doors.
answer: Ça ouvre des portes.; The same saying in English and French.

question: a subject (in school)
answer: une matière

question: in this field (of work)
answer: dans ce milieu OR dans cette branche (feminine; same as for a tree); le milieu literally translates to 'middle' but it is commonly used to mean something like field or area or place

question: a branch (of a tree) + a branch (of a subject)
answer: une tige + une branche

question: an industry
answer: un domaine (most idiomatic) / une filière / une industrie / un secteur d'activité / une sphère; e.g. J'aime bien mon domain.

question: industries: clothing + housing
answer: l'habillement (masculine) + le logement; habillement is in some way related to oufitted / well equiped. habile = skilled / capable. une habilité = the capacity to succeed.

question: industries: travel/tourism + transportation
answer: les voyages (masculine) + les transports (masculine)

question: industries: healthcare + logistics
answer: la santé + la logistique

question: industries: trade + sales
answer: le commerce + la vente; la vente = a sale

question: industries: business services + personal services
answer: les métiers de services + les services aux personnes (OR aux particuliers)

question: the work
answer: le travail; Alternative: les liverables = the work products

question: a job
answer: un poste (a position - connotes something permanent) / une profession / un travail / un métier / un emploi / un job (pronounced as in English; connotes something temporary) / un boulot / un taff; The former are more formal. The latter are less formal.

question: a work contract
answer: un contrat ('koh-trah') de travail; NB: CDI = contrat à durée indéterminé; CDD = contrat à durée déterminé

question: an intership + an intern + an apprenticeship
answer: un stage + un(e) stagiaire + un apprentissage; réaliser des stages = to do an internship; NB: une alternance = a position where you work part of the time and study part of the time

question: a scholarship
answer: une bourse (d'étude); une bourse = a small sac for carrying coins

question: to work
answer: travailler OR bosser (more familiar)

question: to work hard (at your job)
answer: travailler/bosser dur; Alternative idiomatic saying: travailler comme un forcené = to work like a madman

question: to work hard towards some goal (not necessarily at your job)
answer: faire l'effort de faire quelque chose (neutral connotation); Alternative expression: prendre la peine de faire quelque chose. This means to work really hard at something but it connotes that others did not work as hard. It has a little bit of 'so what are you doing about it?' energy.

question: Expression that means: to work very quickly / to accelerate an action
answer: mettre les bouchées doubles; literally: to put the double mouths

question: to work remotely (as a person doing a job)
answer: travailler en télétravail OR faire du téletravail; informal: être en TT = to be working remotely. e.g. Je suis en TT aujourd'hui. = I'm working remotely today.

question: to work remotely (when a device works remotely)
answer: fonctionner à distance

question: to transmit
answer: transmettre

question: to work full-time + to work part-time
answer: travailler à temps plein + travailler à temps partiel

question: over-time work
answer: heures supplémentaires

question: to work on some thing (e.g. a project)
answer: travailler SUR quelque chose

question: to be unemployed
answer: être sans emploi / être au chômage; e.g. Je suis sans emploi... is much more common in french than to say: Je ne travaille pas.; l'emploi = the employment

question: the workforce
answer: le monde du travail (in general) OR les effectifs (the number of workers)

question: a career
answer: une carrière; NB: carriériste is a derogatory adjective to describe someone who is concerned mainly with advancement in their profession.

question: a job search
answer: un recherche d'emploi

question: a temp agency
answer: une agence d'interim; France Travail is the public organization that helps people find jobs.

question: a person who can help you professionally (e.g. get you an interview)
answer: un piston; This is a familiar use of the word. It also means a mechanical piston.

question: She/he is a 'new grad' / recent graduate.
answer: Elle est récemment diplômé(e).; NB: un(e) titulaire (de X) = a holder (of X diploma)

question: She/he is a job seeker / looking for work.
answer: Elle/Il cherche du travail.; Use CHERCHER.

question: He/she is an applicant (for a job).
answer: Il/elle est demandeur/demandeuse.

question: She/he is a candidate (for a job).
answer: Elle/il est candidat(e).; la candidature = the candidacy; candidater = to run for office

question: He/she is employed.
answer: Il/elle est employé(e) / embauché(e) / pris(e).; pris(e) means something like 'taken'

question: She is retired.
answer: Elle est retraité(e). OR Elle est à la retrait. OR Elle est en retraite.

question: a retiree (a person who is retired)
answer: un(e) retraité(e)

question: to retire + to resign (from a job)
answer: partir à la retraite + démissioner

question: an employee (masc + fem); Specify pronunciation.
answer: un(e) employé(e) OR un(e) salarié(e) ('sah-lah-rEE-AY'; Make sure you make two vowel - for both m/f - to differentiate the word from salaire = salary); The latter is for salaried employees.

question: a manual worker + a worker that is not necessarily manual (masc + fem)
answer: un(e) ouvrier/ouvrière + un(e) travailleur/travailleuse; NB: travailleur/travailleuse can also be used as an adjective to describe someone who is hard-working with positive connotation - it does not mean workaholic.; Alternative: un actif = an actively employed person

question: an employer (masc + fem)
answer: un employeur + une employeuse

question: an executive (masc + fem) + a CEO
answer: un(e) cadre (same m/f) + un(e) PDG = président(e) directeur/rice général(e)

question: a shareholder (masc + fem) + an investor (masc + fem)
answer: un(e) actionnaire + un(e) investisseur

question: an industrialist
answer: un(e) industriel(le)

question: the board of directors (of a corporation)
answer: le conseil d'administration

question: a founder (of a company)
answer: un fondateur + une fondatrice

question: the fundraising
answer: la levée de fonds

question: to be paid for doing nothing
answer: être payé(e) à rien faire

question: a golden parachute + the golden handcuffs (in business)
answer: un parachute doré + les menottes dorées

question: the management (of some part of a business)
answer: la gestion; e.g. gestion de projet = project management; e.g. gestion de fichiers = file management; This is useful for listing competencies on a CV.; la gestion can also be used to describe the management of any kind of situation

question: many levels of management + a heirarchy
answer: beaucoup de niveaux de gestion + une hiérarchie

question: an administrative framework
answer: un cadre administratif; un cadre literally means frame but it can mean framework. It can be used figuratively in many ways.

question: the standard of living
answer: le train de vie OR la cadre de vie; le train de vie: specifically refers to the level of living based on money; la qualité de la vie: probably a better way to express this

question: for a better standard of living
answer: pour un meilleur cadre de vie OR pour une meilleure qualité de la vie; un cadre literally means frame but it can be used figuratively in many ways.

question: the way of life (in a certain place)
answer: le cadre de vie; Le cadre de vie est idéal. = The way of living is ideal! This is an idiomatic way to talk about a place that you are visiting. This includes the surroundings and setting.

question: a manager (masc + fem)
answer: There are at least 3 options: 1) un directeur / une directrice: the general title for a manager in a company; 2) un(e) gérant(e): a general manager / the person who runs a shop or restaurant or part of a business; 3) un(e) responsable des ...: The person in charge of something e.g. the person in charge of vegetables in a restaurant = un/une responsable des légumes

question: She is responsible for the modern way of cooking.
answer: Elle est responsable de la façon moderne de cuisiner.

question: a boss (masc + fem)
answer: un(e) patron(ne) OR un(e) chef(fe)

question: a recruiter + an HR representative
answer: un(e) recruteur + un(e) responsable RH; This uses one of the options for describing a manager of something: un(e) responsable des ...

question: a union (e.g. a worker's union); Specify pronunciation.
answer: un syndicat ('sahn-dee-kah'); The Y is not pronounced like 'ee'.

question: to employ
answer: employer/recruter/embaucher; EMPLOYER can also mean 'to use' / 'to employ in the use of' just as it is used in English.

question: the job market
answer: le marché du travail

question: a job fair
answer: un salon d l'emploi

question: a job opening/posting
answer: une offre d'emploi OR une perspective d'emploi; 'offre d'emploi' is NOT an offer letter - it's more like an offering. 'perspective d'emploi' is not a perspective.

question: There is a set number of openings (for a job or school).
answer: Il y a un nombre de places.; Only use numéro and chiffre when you mean specific digits (not a count).

question: to apply for a job
answer: postuler à; e.g. I applied to a job opening. = J'ai postulé à une offre d'emploi.; Alternative: envoyer beaucoup de candidatures; POSTER = to send. POSTULER = to submit an application. PUBLIER = to post something on social media.

question: to send an offer letter (to a candidate)
answer: poster une offre; POSTER = to send. POSTULER = to submit an application. PUBLIER = to post something on social media.

question: to recruit for a job
answer: recruter

question: to apply for french citizenship
answer: postuler à la nationalité française; POSTER = to send. POSTULER = to send an application for something

question: to submit (an application / a request e.g. to the government)
answer: déposer sa demande; e.g. J'ai déposé ma demande. = I submitted/filed an application.; déposer un brevet = to file for a patent; If you mean to apply for a position or nationality then use POSTULER instead.

question: to lodge a formal complaint (against someone/something)
answer: porter/déposer plainte contre (qqn/qqch); se plaindre = to complain when speaking - not to submit a formal complaint in writing

question: an acceptance + a refusal (of a job offer)
answer: une acceptation + un refus (S is silent)

question: What are the five standard sections of a french CV?
answer: 1) identity including contact information 2) diplomas listed from newest to oldest (including years) 3) jobs held listed from newest to oldest (including years) 4) competencies / list of skills (e.g. natural and programming languages) 5) a very short list of hobbies/activities - though this could be included in the letter of motivation instead

question: a cover letter
answer: une lettre de motivation; le motif = the motivation / reason for doing something

question: a reference / a letter of recommendation
answer: une lettre de recommendation

question: an update (e.g. for a software version)
answer: une mise à jour; e.g. Je dois installer la mise à jour. = I must install the most recent update.; une mise = an act of putting / a placement

question: updated / up-to-date
answer: mis à jour; e.g. un CV mis à jour = an updated CV

question: to update (someone) + to update (something)
answer: mettre à jour quelqu'un / quelque chose (no preposition required); The phrase is exactly the same whether you mean to keep a person updated about information or whether you are updating a thing (e.g. an identity card).

question: I must update my skills.
answer: Je dois mettre à jour mes compétences.

question: to keep someone updated with the latest information (e.g. the time to meet someone)
answer: SE TENIR au courant tenir quelqu'un au jus; Alternative: SE TENIR au jus (tenir = to hold)

question: We will keep eachother posted. + I will keep you posted.
answer: On se tient au courant. + Je te tiens au courant.; SE TENIR (or TENIR quelqu'un) au courant = to keep abreast of some topic

question: What is le CR?
answer: compte rendu = the minutes of a meeting

question: I had a job interview 5 years ago.
answer: J'ai passé un entretien d'embauche il y a 5 ans.

question: There were many questions to which I didn't know the answer.
answer: Il y avait beaucoup de questions auxquelles je ne savais pas répondre.

question: What will you do if I have too much work?
answer: Que ferez-vous si j'ai trop de travail?

question: an advantages + a disadvantage
answer: un avantage (or un bénefice) + un inconvénient; inconvénient is a faux ami. It means disadvantage. incommode = inconvenient or impractical

question: a lot of upside / a lot to gain
answer: énormément À gagner; This is a better alternative to: beaucoup d'avantages

question: What are the disadvantages of this work?
answer: Quels sont les inconvénients de ce travail?

question: the amount of the salary
answer: le montant du salaire

question: the work hours (when you are expected to be working)
answer: les horaires de travail (flexibilites ou fixes)

question: daily (e.g. daily routine) + on a daily basis; Specify pronunciation.
answer: quotidien/quotidienne (m/f) + au quotidien ('koh-tee-dyohn'; Strong O sound to start and then finish with a very nasal E.)

question: the daily routine
answer: le quotidien OR la routine quotidienne

question: weekly / every week
answer: hebdomadaire; e.g. temps de travail hebdomadaire = number of hours worked per week

question: monthly (every month)
answer: mensuelle

question: yearly / annually (every year)
answer: annuelle

question: a work environment
answer: un environnement de travail; The first syllable of environnement is super nasal. It's like 'ohn' but the N is silent.

question: seniority (how long someone has worked a job)
answer: l'ancienneté (feminine)

question: online/virtual (e.g. online meeting)
answer: en virtuelle; Alternative: la modalité virtuelle

question: in person (e.g. when a class is onsite instead of online)
answer: en personne OR face à face; less idiomatic alternatives: en sur site (on-site) + en présentielle + la modalité présentielle; epxression that means face to face: en chair et en ose

question: I must be there in person.
answer: Je dois travail en sur site. OR Je dois me présenter en personne.; Alternative: Il faudrait que je me déplace. (SE) DÉPLACER = to move (oneself) from one place to another.

question: Please respect the right to disconnect. (outside of work)
answer: SVP Respetez la droit à la déconnexion.; Alternative: Je dois décrocher DU travail. = I must unhook (in a literal or figurative sense) from work.

question: I don't want to be disturbed. (after work; e.g. for oncall)
answer: Je ne veux pas être déranger.; When you negate VOULOIR it is unusual to use the conditionnel tense (even when you would use it in the un-negated form). Use: ne veux pas (instead of ne voudrais pas).

question: One can have better work-life balance than other jobs.
answer: On peut avoir MEILLEUR équilibre que des autres métiers.; équilibre is the word to use for a figurative balance.

question: One can have a more flexible schedule than other jobs.
answer: La période de travaille est plus flexible que des autres métiers.

question: The job has more flexibility and a good salary.
answer: Ce travail offre beaucoup de flexibilité et un bon salaire.

question: There is more opportunity to meet interesting/creative people that other jobs.
answer: Il y a plus d'opportunité de rencontrer les personnes interessants et creatifs que des autres métiers.

question: A worker can quit their job at any time. (in the US)
answer: Un traivailleur peut décomissioner de l'enterprise à tout moment.

question: A company can fire a worker at any time. (in the US)
answer: Une enterprise peut licencier un traveilleur à tout moment.

question: to fire (someone from a job)
answer: licencier or virer

question: He was fired by the company.
answer: Il a été viré (passive voice + passé composé) par l'enterprise.; Preposition PAR (= by way of) explains causation in terms of the manner or the place. POUR expains causation in terms of goals.

question: I need vacation.
answer: J'ai besoin DE vacances.; avoir besoin triggers DE; vacation (vacances) is always plural in french.

question: My ideal job has lots of vacation.
answer: Mon travail idéal me permet d'avoir beaucoup de vacances.

question: my dream job
answer: le travail de mes rêves

question: a job ammenable to my preferences
answer: un travail aménagé; aménager = to arrange (like furniture). So un travail aménagé is something like: a job that is well-arranged to my needs.

question: idiomatic way to express: to be up to the task (of doing some job)
answer: être la hauteur

question: idiomatic way to express: to do business / to do the operations of a company
answer: faire marcher les affaires; This is similar to 'to take care of business' but in a more concrete way. It is not used as a euphomism in French.

question: idiomatic way to express: to get the job done; Specify pronunciation.
answer: faire le job; Job is pronounced as in english. The J is hard (not 'zsh').

question: to manage a project + to pilot a project
answer: gérer un projet + piloter un projet

question: to facilitate + to escalate (up the management chain)
answer: faciliter + faire remonter

question: to have meetings
answer: avoir des réunions

question: to give a presentation
answer: faire une présentation ou une démonstration (both feminine)

question: to give a live demo
answer: faire une démonstration en direct; DÉMONTRER is used more in the literal/mathematical sense... to demonstrate a theory / demonstrate proof of something.

question: to be written up (for something negative) at work
answer: renvoyer (literally: to send back); Conjugate same as ENVOYER.

question: a discussion + a conference
answer: un discours + une conférence; faire un monologue = to go on and on without letting others speak

question: a conference center
answer: un centre de conférence

question: to make a suggestion
answer: faire une proposition/une suggestion; The connotations (proposition = proposal; suggestion= suggestion) are the same from French to English. une proposition = the presentation of an option (no pressure); une suggestion = a proposal or insinuation that is not completly neutral (some pressure)

question: Raise your hand to vote.
answer: Levez la main pour voter.; Use lever (instead of élever) to indicate the rising up of a body part or the rising up of a body in the morning.

question: to remodel the website
answer: remodeler le site web

question: to code a lot
answer: faire beaucoup de codage/programmation

question: idiomatic ways to talk about teamwork
answer: 1) avoir l'esprit d'équipe = to have team spirit 2) travailler en equipée = to work on a team; You can use both verbs to talk about teamwork.

question: idiomatic way to talk about a sense of community and solidarity
answer: esprit de groupe; la solidarité = solidarity; une entraide = solidarity / a commitement to mutual aid

question: to be flexible / adaptable (when describing yourself in a job interview)
answer: être flexible OR faire preuve d'adaptation; faire preuve = to demonstrate

question: to work under pressure
answer: travailler sous préssion OR gérer le stress (to manage the stress); the pressure = la pression

question: multi-tasking
answer: multitâche. travailler bien en mode multitâche = to work well multi-tasking; Alternative: polyvalent(e) = versatile and comprehensive. This is slightly different than being good at multi-tasking.

question: to delivery on-time / to respect deadlines
answer: respecter les délais

question: to seize every opportunity
answer: saisir toute opportunité; NB: une saisie = a seizure (of property) or the input to a conversation

question: pro-active (describing a person)
answer: force de proposition; e.g. Je suis force de proposition.

question: a proposal
answer: une proposition

question: to acquire new skills
answer: acquérir de nouvelles compétences

question: an experience + new experiences
answer: une expérience + les nouvelles experiences

question: an experienced person
answer: une personne expérimentée (not expériencée - this adjective does not exist)

question: to have experience in X
answer: avoir de l'expérience en X; The verb expérimenter exists but it means 'to experiment'.

question: to have an experience
answer: avoir vécu une expérience OR avoir fait une expérience; The verb expérimenter exists but it means 'to experiment'.

question: to grow in experience (in a job)
answer: enricher mon experience; Alternative: améliorer mon CV

question: to progress in my career
answer: évoluer dans ma carrière; ÉVOLUER = to evolve

question: to change jobs + careers
answer: changer de métier + changer de carrière; NB: métier de bouche = hospitality; NB: métier d'avenir = industry/careers of the future; When you replace something with another: changer + de + noun. When you transform something: changer + noun.

question: to get more responsibility
answer: obtenir plus de responsibilités; tenir = to hold

question: to earn more money + to learn more
answer: pour gagner plus (silent S) d'argent + pour apprendre plus (pronounce the S)

question: to broaden your horizon (e.g. more employment opportunities)
answer: élargir votre horizon (masculine)

question: to get out of your comfort zone
answer: sortir de votre zone de confort

question: to establish an international network (of contacts)
answer: établir un réseau de contacts internationaux

question: to grow my professional network
answer: pour étendre mon réseau professionnel; réseau sociaux = social media (not a network of real people)

question: to know how to communicate well
answer: bien savoir commiquer; Use SAVOIR (instead of connaître) to describe knowing how to do something.

question: to have hindsight
answer: prendre du recul

question: to have empathy for someone
answer: ressentir de l'empathie envers quelqu'un ; Do not use avoir de l'empathie.; Use envers (instead of vers) when you mean an attitude or behavior toward a person or thing.

question: to provide + to foster
answer: fournir + favoriser; e.g. fournir/favoriser une culture tolérante = to provide/foster a tolerant culture

question: to support
answer: Depends on meaning: 1) SOUTENIR: to support someone/something physically or emotionally (NOT financially). It can also mean to encourage vaguely someone in their ambitions.; 2) ENCOURAGER: to encourage someone to do something specific; 3) FINANCER: to finance something or financially support someone; NB: SUPPORTER (to be able to withstand) is a faux ami.

question: They gave him a lot of (emotional) support.
answer: Ils lui ont donné beaucoup de soutien.; le soutien = the support (physical support or emotional support; financial support must be phrased differently)

question: the people who support me
answer: des personnes qui me soutiennent

question: to be comfortable with computers
answer: avoir le sens ('sohnS'; S is pronounced) informatique

question: to know how to use certain technologies
answer: savoir utiliser certaines technologies; Use SAVOIR (instead of connaître) to describe knowing how to do something.

question: to find a solution
answer: trouver une solution

question: to fix a problem
answer: régler un problème OR résoudre (to resolve) coun problème; Alternative: gérer la situation = to manage the situation; NB: régler is good for solving a problem. réglementer is for regulating / making laws.

question: to address a problem
answer: s'attaquer; e.g. La technologie ne s'attaque pas la cause du problème. = The technology does not address the cause of the problem.; If you really want to express aggressively attacking a problem: entrer dans le vif du sujet = get to the heart of the problem

question: the points to tackle (when solving a problem)
answer: les points à aborder; aborder = to tackle

question: to resolve conflict
answer: garder le contrôle de la situation

question: idiomatic way to express that you are struggling with a difficult problem and not finding a solution
answer: Je me casse la tête... sur ce problème.; This uses CASSER reflexively (se casser la tête). se casser une dente = to break a tooth

question: idiomatic way to express that you are not addressing the real problem
answer: tourner autour du pot = to beat around the bush

question: a technical problem
answer: un problème technique; La problematique is another word for problem.

question: a manufacturing default
answer: un défaut de fabrication

question: by default
answer: par défaut; Preposition PAR (= by way of) explains causation in terms of the manner or the place.

question: to troubleshoot
answer: dépanner; la panne = the damage / the breakdown; a nervous breakdown = une crise de nerfs

question: to participate
answer: participer à qqch; This also means to contribute.; Alternative: s'impliquer = to be involved because une implication means an involvement

question: to sell + to resell
answer: vendre + revendre

question: to exchange + in exchange for X
answer: échanger + en échange DE X; Je veux échanger les chaussettes contre un chapeau. = I want to exchange the socks for a hat.

question: to exchange the books
answer: s'échanger les livres; Use the reflexive form if you do not spell out both objects.; to exchange them = se les échanger

question: to send (in general) + to mail (using the post office)
answer: envoyer + poster; NB: ENVOYER is conjugated similar (not exactly) to VOIR. Add EN in front. e.g. Je vois. J'envoie. = I see. I send.   Je verrai. J'enverrai. = I will see. I will send.

question: idiomatic way to say: send a message/text
answer: faire passer un message

question: It's in the mail.
answer: C'est posté. This uses POSTER in passe composé.; For example: J'ai posté la lettre hier. = I mailed (or 'posted') the letter yesterday.

question: to watch / look at
answer: regarder; to watch television = regarder la télé(vision)

question: to look for / I am looking for a jacket (in a store).
answer: chercher / Je cherche ('shersh') une veste.; rechercher is similar but more thorough - perhaps meaning to research or seek

question: to show + to demonstrate
answer: montrer + démontrer; NB: This is different from MONTER (to go up OR to put something up) and DÉMONTER (to disassemble).; Alternative: faire visiter e.g. Elle fait visiter son appartement. = She shows her apartment.

question: to celebrate + We celebrate.
answer: fêter + On fait la fête. (literally: we make a celebration)

question: a party animal
answer: un(e) fêtard(e)

question: to hesitate + to hesitate to ask
answer: hésiter + hésiter À demander/poser des questions; hésiter triggers À before the verb.

question: to ask (for something) + to ask (a question) ...2 different verbs
answer: demander (quelque chose) + poser (une question)

question: She asked me to create a poster.
answer: Elle m'a demandé DE créer une affiche.; DE between demander and créer. No preposition following créer because whatever is a created is a COD.; Use DEMANDER to ask for something. Use POSER to ask a question.

question: He asked me a question.
answer: Il m'a posé une question.; Use DEMANDER to ask for something. Use POSER to ask a question.

question: She displays/exudes optimism.
answer: Elle affiche de l'optimisme; Use AFFICHER + de + qqch (to display or exude something) which is related to une affiche (a poster).

question: a request + a demand
answer: une demande (a request) + une requête (a demand); Take care because these are 'faux amis'. The words that sound similar to English words actually have the opposite meaning in French.; Une demande can also mean the demand (the high number of requests) for a product.

question: There is a lot of demand for this product.
answer: Il y a une grande demande pour ce produit.; Do not use beaucoup de... in this case.; une demande = a request. We can use it to speak about demand for a product in terms of a very large request.

question: to make a request to something (in computing)
answer: passer commande (automatiquement) sur quelque chose; This only works for computing. If you mean to make a request face to face or to an institution then you need to use a different verb. e.g. déposer

question: to require / to demand
answer: exiger (very strong); e.g. J'exige de parler au manager. You would only say this if you were extremely upset/entitled. ; e.g. Mon travail exige que j'ai une tenue correct. = My job requires that I wear the correct outfit. But EXIGER means that the level of the job (or the standards of the job) is such that the object of the verb is inexplicitly required. This is not something that is on a job description or that your boss tells you to do. It means that the level of the job demands a certain type of behavior - one must rise to that occassion.; EXIGER que... triggers subjonctif mood.

question: demanding (e.g. a demanding client or professor)
answer: exigeant(e); This comes from the verb EXIGER: to demand a certain level of behavior. It is a very strong adjective.

question: to be required
answer: exigé(e); e.g. le niveau exigé = the level required

question: pushy (slang)
answer: gonflé(a)

question: lenient
answer: indulgent(e) OR clément(e)

question: to respond to a question
answer: réprondre À une question; RÉPONDRE triggers the preposition À

question: to deny
answer: nier

question: to be paid
answer: être rémunéré(e); This comes from the verb RÉMUNERER (to remunerate).

question: idiomatic way to say that someone is very generous
answer: être dépensier; like DÉPENSER

question: conjugate payer (to pay) au présent
answer: je paye/paie + tu payes/paies + il paye/paie + nous payons + vous payez + ils payent/paient; Payer is a -YER verb so for all forms (except nous and vous) the Y can stay or it can be changed to I. Both forms are correct.

question: List 5 verbs ending in -YER and explain what is special about their conjugation.
answer: payer (to pay) + essayer (to try) + nettoyer (to clean) + envoyer (to send) + effrayer (to frighten) + s'ennuyer (to be bored); -YER verbs can be conjugated in two ways au présent that are totally correct... for all forms (except nous and vous) the Y can stay or it can be changed to I.

question: to reimburse
answer: rembourser

question: to be reimbursed
answer: remboursé(e) OR dédommagé(e); Alternatives: recevoir un remboursement + se faire rembourser

question: I would like to be reimbursed.
answer: Je voudrais me faire rembourser.

question: the refund
answer: le remboursement; le remboursement intégralement = a complete refund 100%

question: I would like to pay with cash + card + check + ApplePay.
answer: Je voudrais payer en liquide OR en espèces + par carte bancaire + par chèque + par ApplePay (or whatever the app is called). Do not say 'par app' when trying to pay with an app. Use the name of it.; Preposition PAR (= by way of) explains causation in terms of the manner or the place.

question: a wallet + a change purse
answer: un portefeuille + un porte-monnaie

question: money; Give the proper word and the slang word.
answer: Proper: argent + Slang: sous (it is always plural); Je ne plus beaucoup de sous. = I don't have much money.

question: a banknote (like a 100 dollar bill)
answer: un billet ('bee-yay')

question: a coin
answer: une pièce de monnaie

question: change (some coins)
answer: de la monnaie OR des espèces

question: I have savings. (money in the bank)
answer: There are three ways to express this: 1) J'ai des économies. 2) J'ai l'argent de côté. Do not forget the accent to indicate 'on the side' (as opposed to the coast). 3) J'ai l'épargne. une èpargne = a saving(s)

question: an investment (literal or figurative)
answer: un investissement; This is used the same way in french as in english. It can be commitment of money + time + effort.

question: a stock (listed on a stock market)
answer: une action

question: a stock price
answer: un cours de l'action; Un cours can mean a negotiated price for a good. Une action can mean a piece of stock in a company.

question: the stock market
answer: la bourse; Bourse is the most common way to refer to the stock exchange or stock market in general.; Alternative: le marché boursier (more literal - less idiomatic)

question: The stock is publically traded.
answer: L'action est (cotée) en bourse.; en bourse = on a stock exchange; coté(e) = to be listed

question: The company is privately held.
answer: L'entreprise n'est pas en bourse.

question: to save money
answer: économiser OR épargner; ÉCONOMISER is more commonly used.

question: When I was young I didn't save money.
answer: Quand j'était jeune je n'épargnais pas.; Use imparfait because this is not a precise event.

question: How do you ask for the check at a restaurant?
answer: l'addition s'il vous plaît

question: the sum / the total
answer: la somme; e.g. la somme DES taxes

question: a salary + minimum wage
answer: un salaire + smic; arrondir les fins de mois = an expression that means to get paid more

question: a bonus (on top of a salary)
answer: la prime; NB: Social security benefits in France are usually based on salary - they likely will not reflect income from bonuses.

question: the gross + the net (e.g. of a salary)
answer: le brut + le net; NB: The ending T is pronounced in both words.

question: the profit
answer: le bénéfice; This word also means an advantage or a benefit (the additional perks offered by an employer).

question: profitable
answer: rentable

question: financial gains
answer: des gains financiers

question: a personal gain
answer: un gain personnel

question: the employment rate + the turnover of employees
answer: le taux d'emploi + le taux de rotation du personnel

question: a monopoly
answer: un monopole

question: a fee
answer: les frais (feminine) OR les honoraires (masculine) OR les charges; All are used exclusively in the plural for this meaning. If you use the singular forms the meaning is slightly different.; alternative: une amende

question: an expense
answer: une dépense

question: the shipping fees + the delivery fees
answer: les frais d'expédition + les frais de livraison

question: free + included
answer: gratuit(e) + inclu(s) OR compris(e)

question: all-included + charges included
answer: tout compris + les/toutes charges comprises (TCC)

question: Returns (of a purchase) are free.
answer: Le retour est inclus.

question: to tax (an action a country takes)
answer: taxer

question: a tax (general) + a tax (on income)
answer: une tax (feminine) + un impôt (masculine)

question: a tip (for a server)
answer: un pourboire; literally 'for a drink'

question: a tip/trick (for doing something fast/well)
answer: une astuce = a good tip/trick; un conseil = a piece of advice

question: a bribe
answer: un pot-de-vin

question: an item number (e.g. SKU)
answer: une référence

question: a warranty
answer: une garantie

question: the sales policy (when purchasing an item)
answer: la politique de vente

question: an order (like an online purchase) + to place an order
answer: la commande + passer une commande

question: an order (like from a court of law)
answer: un mandat

question: to pay a bill
answer: régler une facture

question: a purchase order
answer: le bon de commande

question: a purchase
answer: un achat ('ah-sha'; same pronunciation when plural); This is derived from acheter (to buy).

question: a coupon
answer: un bon de réduction; This is how 'bon'/'bonne' can be used as a noun.; e.g. un bon de livraison = the packing list that comes with a delivery; e.g. une bonne (the good one) des voisons = the good neighbor

question: a 5% discount
answer: une réduction de 5% OR une remise de 5%

question: a credit (on the next order)
answer: un avoir (sur la prochaine commande)

question: a loan
answer: un crédit; prendre un crédit sur 20 ans = to take a 20-year loan

question: a debt
answer: une dette; être dans le rouge = to be in the red (same meaning in english and french)

question: a down payment (on a purchase)
answer: un acompte

question: an asset
answer: un bien

question: wealth
answer: une fortune

question: an invoice
answer: Two possibilities: 1) une facture describes an invoice for a service (e.g. at a hospital) 2) un ticket de caisse describes the itemized receipt you receive at a cash register - not the receipt from the card swipe

question: a receipt (proof of payment when paying for goods or services)
answer: There are three options: 1) un reçu 2) la quittance (for payment of rent) 3) un ticket de caisse.;  None of these is the name for the paper that you receive after swiping a bank card: un ticket de carte

question: the receipt from swiping a card for payment
answer: un ticket de carte; This is different from the itemized receipt that shows what you are being charged for: un ticket de caisse

question: a ticket (as punishment - e.g. a parking ticket)
answer: une amende; This differs from une amande = an almond.

question: income
answer: Two options: 1) le revenu 2) des recettes (always plural in this case); e.g. Les recettes augmentent. = The revenue is growing.; le revenu is the word used to describe personal income (e.g. from a job). It can also be used to describe the revenue of a company.

question: the number / the figure
answer: The word depends on the order of magnitude. 1) le chiffre is a single number (1-9) 2) un nombre is the representation of any number regardless of how large it is

question: a recipe (when cooking)
answer: une recette (singular); NB: This word can be used in its plural form to talk about income.

question: to climb
answer: grimper

question: to drop
answer: faire tomber; e.g. Je fais tomber mon stylo. = I drop my pen.

question: to fall
answer: tomber; e.g. Mon stylo tombe. = My pen falls.; to be timed well = tomber très bien (e.g. Ça tombe très bien. = It is good timing.)

question: to fall in love
answer: tomber amoureux; love at first sight = avoir le coup de foudre / l'amour au premier regard

question: to collapse (downward)
answer: effondrer; Use this for a building that falls down. It can also be used reflexively: Quand je suis fatigué(e) je m'effrondre.; NB: You cannot use EFFONDRER to describe something that collapses inwardly. Use imploser (to implode) for that.

question: My body collapsed.
